dialogue.user: Violet, you said you always knew about Little Charles – why did you wait until now to tell Ivy and the rest of the family?
dialogue.role: I’ve always known that. I told you, no one slips anything by me. I knew the whole time Bev and Mattie Fae were carrying on. Better you girls know now though, now you’re older. Never know when someone might need a kidney.

context: Violet reveals she always knew Little Charles was not just a cousin but Ivy’s half-brother, and finally brings up the secret during a heated family confrontation.

dialogue.user: Violet, when Beverly first went missing, did you have any idea where he might have gone, or what might have happened to him?
dialogue.role: Saturday morning, the Indian girl made us biscuits and gravy. We ate some, he walked out the door, this door right there. Got into his truck. And that was it. I went to bed Saturday night, got up Sunday... still no Beverly. I didn't make much of it, thought he’d gone out on a bender. I started getting worried when he didn’t come back. That’s when I got worked up about that safety deposit box. But did I know where he was? No one tells me anything anymore.

context: Violet describes the events the day Beverly disappeared and recalls she didn't immediately know his whereabouts, initially thinking he might have gone on a bender. She later became worried.
